ground_truth: Joe kneels and picks something up as Cary calls out from behind, having climbed the angled sides of overturned train cars. They move up the mass of metal to reveal a vast view of the wreck, which seems to stretch on forever. Cary points to a pick-up truck thrown fifty yards from the main wreckage, sheared in half and lying in the overgrown grass. As the kids approach from the wreckage, the sight stuns them, and they stop. Inside the crushed truck is Dr. Woodward, 75, seat-belted, bloody, and unconscious. Alice, scared and sad, moves closer and nudges him, realizing he appears dead as his arm drops limp, revealing a paper that falls to the ground. Joe picks up the paper and unfolds it, revealing an old, off-white map. They hold it up and see marker writing on it, a black line from Nevada to Dayton, with numbers along the way. Suddenly, a trembling hand appears and rips the map away, causing them all to scream as Dr. Woodward is revealed, with bloody eyes open and in a daze. Speechless, they finally react but distant voices make Joe turn his head to see through the wreck. Their minds racing, the kids start moving away. Charles grabs his camera as Alice hurries past, searching for her keys while eyeing the approaching flashlight men. Joe grabs his make-up kit and runs to the car, followed by the boys as Alice slams the car into reverse, narrowly avoiding debris and driving away as the flashlight men—soldiers—arrive with adrenaline pumping. Colonel Nelec steps up to the camera, eyeing the vanishing car suspiciously, then looks down at a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box, picks it up, examines it, then back at the disappearing car. His burning eyes focus before the Buick speeds past with a roar, as Charles obsesses over his camera amidst the overlapping mayhem.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Joe bends and lifts something as Cary shouts from behind, having scaled the slanted edges of toppled train cars. They ascend the mass of metal to unveil a vast view of the ruin, which seems to extend on interminably. Cary gestures to a pick-up truck hurled fifty yards from the primary wreckage, split in half and resting in the tangled grass. As the youngsters advance from the wreckage, the sight astonishes them, and they halt. Inside the smashed truck is Dr. Woodward, 75, seat-belted, bloody, and senseless. Alice, frightened and sorrowful, moves nearer and nudges him, realizing he appears deceased as his arm drops limp, revealing a document that falls to the earth. Joe lifts the document and unfolds it, revealing an aged, off-white chart. They hold it up and see marker writing on it, a black line from Nevada to Dayton, with numerals along the way. Suddenly, a trembling hand appears and snatches the chart away, causing them all to shriek as Dr. Woodward is revealed, with bloody eyes open and in a stupor. Speechless, they finally respond but distant voices make Joe turn his head to observe through the ruin. Their minds racing, the youngsters start moving away. Charles seizes his camera as Alice rushes past, searching for her keys while eyeing the approaching torch men. Joe grabs his make-up kit and dashes to the car, followed by the boys as Alice slams the car into reverse, narrowly avoiding debris and driving away as the torch men—soldiers—arrive with adrenaline surging. Colonel Nelec steps up to the camera, eyeing the vanishing car suspiciously, then looks down at a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box, lifts it, inspects it, then back at the disappearing car. His burning eyes focus before the Buick speeds past with a roar, as Charles obsesses over his camera amidst the overlapping chaos.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Joe kneels and something is picked up by him as Cary calls out from behind, having climbed the angled sides of overturned train cars. Up the mass of metal they move to reveal a vast view of the wreck, which is seen to stretch on forever. Cary points to a pick-up truck thrown fifty yards from the main wreckage, sheared in half and lying in the overgrown grass. As the wreckage is approached by the kids, the sight stuns them, and they stop. Inside the crushed truck, Dr. Woodward, 75, is seat-belted, bloody, and unconscious. Alice, scared and sad, moves closer and nudges him, realizing he appears dead as his arm is dropped limp, revealing a paper that falls to the ground. The paper is picked up by Joe and unfolded, revealing an old, off-white map. It is held up by them and marker writing is seen on it, a black line from Nevada to Dayton, with numbers along the way. Suddenly, a trembling hand appears and the map is ripped away, causing them all to scream as Dr. Woodward is revealed, with bloody eyes open and in a daze. Speechless, they finally react but distant voices make Joe turn his head to see through the wreck. Their minds racing, the kids start moving away. Charles grabs his camera as Alice hurries past, searching for her keys while she eyes the approaching flashlight men. Joe’s make-up kit is grabbed by him and he runs to the car, followed by the boys as the car is slammed into reverse by Alice, narrowly avoiding debris and driving away as the flashlight men—soldiers—arrive with adrenaline pumping. Colonel Nelec steps up to the camera, eyeing the vanishing car suspiciously, then looks down at a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box, picks it up, examines it, then looks back at the disappearing car. His burning eyes focus before the Buick speeds past with a roar, as Charles obsesses over his camera amidst the overlapping mayhem.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Joe kneels to pick something up as Cary calls from behind, climbing the overturned train cars' angled sides. They ascend the metal mass to see the wreck stretching endlessly. Cary points to a pick-up truck, split in half fifty yards from the main wreckage, in the grass. The kids, stunned, approach and stop upon seeing Dr. Woodward, 75, seat-belted, bloody, and unconscious inside the crushed truck. Scared and sad, Alice nudges him, noting he seems dead as his limp arm drops, revealing a paper falling to the ground. Joe picks it up, unfolding an old map marked from Nevada to Dayton with numbers. A trembling hand suddenly snatches the map, and they scream as Dr. Woodward, eyes open and dazed, is revealed. Speechless, they react when distant voices make Joe turn to look. The kids, panicked, move away. Charles grabs his camera as Alice searches for her keys and darts past, eyeing approaching flashlight men. Joe snatches his make-up kit and rushes to the car, followed by the boys. Alice reverses, avoiding debris, as soldiers arrive, adrenaline pumping. Colonel Nelec eyes the fleeing car suspiciously, then examines a discarded yellow Super 8 film box, focusing intently before a Buick speeds past with a roar as Charles remains fixated on his camera amidst the chaos.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Joe kneels, picking up something as Cary calls after climbing overturned train cars. They ascend the metal heap, revealing an endless wreck view. Cary points to a truck, sheared and fifty yards from the wreckage, in grass. Approaching, they're stunned. Inside is Dr. Woodward, 75, bloody and unconscious. Alice, scared, nudges him, dislodging a limp arm and a paper. Joe picks and unfolds it—a map with a black line from Nevada to Dayton. Suddenly, a trembling hand grabs the map; they scream seeing bloody-eyed Dr. Woodward. Speechless, they react as distant voices distract Joe. Minds racing, the kids move. Charles grabs his camera, Alice searches for keys, avoiding flashlight men. Joe runs with his make-up kit, Alice reverses the car, narrowly avoiding debris as soldiers arrive. Colonel Nelec, suspicious, examines a fresh, empty film box before the Buick roars past, Charles obsessed with filming amidst chaos.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Joe kneels down carefully and picks something up from the ground just as Cary calls out from behind him. Cary, having skillfully climbed the steep, angled sides of the overturned train cars, is alert and observant. Together, they make the effort to ascend the massive heap of tangled metal to uncover an expansive and vast view of the wreckage, which appears to extend endlessly into the distance. Cary gestures towards a pick-up truck that has been violently hurled fifty yards away from the central wreckage. This vehicle is sheared in half and now lies amidst the wild, overgrown grass. As the group of kids approaches from the site of destruction, the shocking sight leaves them momentarily stunned, bringing them to a halt. Inside the crushed remains of the truck is Dr. Woodward, a 75-year-old man, secured by a seatbelt, his face bloody and unconscious. Alice, filled with fear and sadness, steps cautiously closer and nudges him gently, coming to the terrifying realization that he seems lifeless as his arm drops limply, unintentionally revealing a paper that flutters to the ground. Joe bends down to retrieve the fallen paper and carefully unfolds it, discovering it to be an old, off-white map. Holding it up, they notice marker writing upon it, depicting a black line stretching from Nevada to Dayton, with various numbers marked along the route. Suddenly, a trembling hand emerges and abruptly snatches the map away, causing the group to scream in fright as Dr. Woodward is revealed to be awake, his bloody eyes wide open and appearing dazed. Speechless and in shock, they finally start to react, but distant voices prompt Joe to turn his head, peering through the wreckage. With their minds racing, the kids quickly begin to move away. Charles clutches his camera tightly as Alice dashes past, anxiously searching for her keys while also keeping a wary eye on the men with flashlights who are approaching. Joe swiftly grabs his make-up kit and makes a run for the car, followed closely by the other boys. Alice hastily slams the car into reverse, skillfully maneuvering to avoid debris as they drive away just as the flashlight men—revealed to be soldiers—arrive, adrenaline coursing through their veins. Colonel Nelec steps forward to the camera, suspiciously watching the car vanish from sight, then lowers his gaze to notice a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box on the ground. He picks it up, examining it intently before refocusing his attention on the receding car. His eyes burn with intensity before the Buick speeds past with a roaring engine, while Charles remains fixated on his camera amidst the chaotic and overlapping mayhem.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Joe, with deliberate care and utmost attention, kneels down cautiously to pick something up from the ground, just as Cary's voice rings out from behind him. Cary, who has deftly and with great skill climbed the steep, sharply inclined sides of the overturned train cars, is alert, observant, and on high alert. Together, they exert themselves greatly to ascend the colossal heap of tangled metal in order to uncover an expansive, sweeping view of the extensive wreckage that seems to stretch on endlessly, reaching far into the distance. Cary makes a gesture towards a pick-up truck that has been violently thrown fifty yards away from the primary wreckage. This vehicle is gruesomely sheared in half and now rests amidst the wild, overgrown, untamed grass. As the group of kids makes their cautious approach from the site of destruction, they are momentarily struck with shock at the staggering sight, which brings them to an abrupt halt. Inside the crushed remains of this truck is Dr. Woodward, a 75-year-old man who is still strapped in by a seatbelt, with his face bloody and appearing unconscious. Alice, overwhelmed with fear and deep sadness, steps forward with great caution and nudges him gently, coming to the terrifying realization that he seems lifeless as his arm falls limply, unintentionally revealing a piece of paper that flutters to the ground. Joe leans down to retrieve the fallen paper and unfolds it with care, discovering it to be an aged, off-white map. As he holds it up, they notice marker writing upon it, depicting a distinct black line stretching from Nevada to Dayton, with various numbers marked meticulously along the route. Suddenly, a trembling hand emerges unexpectedly and snatches the map away with swift abruptness, causing the group to scream in fright as Dr. Woodward is revealed to be awake, his bloody eyes wide open and appearing dazed. Speechless and in a state of shock, they finally begin to react, but distant voices prompt Joe to turn his head, peering through the wreckage with urgency. Their minds racing with adrenaline, the kids quickly begin to move away in haste. Charles clutches his camera tightly as Alice quickly dashes past, anxiously searching for her keys while also keeping a wary eye on the approaching men with flashlights. Joe swiftly grabs his make-up kit and makes a run for the car, followed closely by the other boys. Alice hastily slams the car into reverse, skillfully maneuvering to avoid debris as they drive away just as the flashlight men—revealed to be soldiers—arrive, adrenaline coursing through their veins. Colonel Nelec steps forward towards the camera with suspicion, watching the car vanish from sight, then lowers his gaze to notice a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box lying on the ground. He picks it up, examining it intently with curiosity before refocusing his attention on the receding car. His eyes burn with intensity before the Buick speeds past with a roaring engine, while Charles remains fixated on his camera amidst the chaotic and overlapping mayhem.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Joe kneels down carefully, his knees making contact with the ground as he steadies himself and extends his hand to pick something up, just as Cary's voice calls out behind him. Cary has skillfully climbed the steep, angled sides of the overturned train cars, his feet finding purchase on the twisted metal, enabling him to gain an elevated perspective. Together, they navigate their way up the massive heap of tangled metal, climbing with determination until they reach a vantage point that unfolds a vast and seemingly endless view of the wreckage before them. The scene is both awe-inspiring and devastating, a sprawling chaos of debris that stretches far into the distance. Cary's arm extends outward as he points to a notable sight—a pick-up truck, thrown forcefully fifty yards from the heart of the main wreckage. The truck is violently split in two, its halves resting in the wild tangle of overgrown grass. As they draw closer to this part of the wreckage, the kids are overtaken by shock and pause in their tracks, the sight before them too surreal to fully grasp. Inside the mangled remains of the truck, Dr. Woodward, aged 75, is slumped, restrained by his seatbelt, his body bloody and lifeless in appearance. Alice, her emotions a mixture of fear and sadness, steps forward hesitantly, urged by a blend of concern and dread, and gently nudges Dr. Woodward, her movement tentative and compassionate. Her heart sinks as she perceives that he seems deceased, her suspicion confirmed as his arm falls limply to his side, causing a paper to slip from his grasp and descend to the ground. Joe reaches for this paper, picking it up with careful fingers and meticulously unfolds it to reveal what appears to be an old, off-white map. The kids huddle together, holding the map up for a clearer view, eyes scanning the surface to decipher its markings, which include a bold, black line stretching from Nevada to Dayton, with cryptic numbers interspersed along the route. Their examination is abruptly interrupted as a trembling hand emerges from off-screen, snatching the map from their grip. The suddenness of the action elicits a collective scream from the group, shock overtaking them as they turn to see Dr. Woodward, who moments before seemed lifeless, now with bloody eyes wide open, staring blankly, still in a daze. For a moment, they are frozen, speechlessly processing the reality of this startling revelation, until the sound of distant voices penetrates the fog of their thoughts, prompting Joe to turn his head instinctively toward the wreckage to identify the source. The urgency of the situation propels their minds into overdrive, and the kids instinctively begin to retreat, their bodies moving almost independently of their thoughts. Charles, amidst the rush, snatches up his camera, his fingers wrapping around it with a sense of urgency, as Alice swiftly passes by, her eyes darting as she searches frantically for her keys, all while remaining acutely aware of the flashlight-bearing men drawing nearer. Joe hastily grabs his make-up kit, the familiar weight of it reassuring in his hands, and makes a quick dash to the car, the boys trailing closely behind. With everyone inside, Alice slams the car into gear, reversing rapidly, her focus entirely on navigating a path clear of debris, her heart racing as she drives them away just in time to avoid the soldiers, their flashlights piercing the darkness with beams of light. Among these soldiers is Colonel Nelec, who steps forward with a commanding presence, his eyes narrowing with suspicion as he watches the car vanish into the distance. His attention is momentarily diverted to a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box lying conspicuously on the ground. He bends down to pick it up, his fingers brushing against the cardboard as he examines it briefly, his mind piecing together the puzzle, before casting his gaze back toward the disappearing vehicle, his eyes burning with determination. In a sudden burst of action, a Buick speeds by with an audible roar, Charles obsessing over his camera, the lens capturing the chaotic tapestry of events unfolding around them amidst the layered cacophony of the moment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Joe and Cary ascend the angled sides of the overturned train cars to survey the wreck, revealing a vast, seemingly endless view of devastation. Cary spots a pick-up truck, sheared in half and thrown into the overgrown grass. As the kids approach, they are stunned by the sight of Dr. Woodward, 75, unconscious and bloody inside the crushed truck. Alice, filled with fear and sadness, nudges Dr. Woodward, inadvertently causing a limp arm to release a paper that Joe retrieves. Upon unfolding it, they discover an old map marked with a black line from Nevada to Dayton and various numbers. Abruptly, a trembling hand snatches the map, revealing a dazed Dr. Woodward, prompting the kids to scream. Their shock is interrupted by distant voices, causing Joe to look through the wreckage. Quickly gathering their wits, they start to retreat. Charles grabs his camera as Alice searches for her keys, and Joe collects his make-up kit. Alice reverses the car, narrowly missing debris, and drives away just as flashlight-wielding soldiers arrive. Colonel Nelec, appearing suspicious, examines a fresh Super 8 film box before staring intently at the departing car, while Charles remains fixated on his camera amidst the chaos.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Joe kneels and picks something up as Cary calls out from behind, having climbed the angled sides of overturned train cars, remnants of a recent catastrophic derailment near their small town. They move up the mass of metal to reveal a vast view of the wreck, which seems to stretch on forever, illustrating the scale of the disaster. Cary points to a pick-up truck thrown fifty yards from the main wreckage, sheared in half and lying in the overgrown grass that had once bordered a cornfield. As the kids approach from the wreckage, the sight stuns them, and they stop in shock. Inside the crushed truck is Dr. Woodward, a respected local archaeologist aged 75, seat-belted, bloody, and unconscious. Alice, scared and sad, moves closer and nudges him, realizing he appears dead as his arm drops limp, revealing a paper that falls to the ground. Joe picks up the paper and unfolds it, revealing an old, off-white map. They hold it up and see marker writing on it, a black line from Nevada, home to the mysterious Area 51, to Dayton, a city known for its aviation history, with numbers along the way that hint at secret coordinates. Suddenly, a trembling hand appears and rips the map away, causing them all to scream as Dr. Woodward is revealed, with bloody eyes open and in a daze. Speechless, they finally react but distant voices make Joe turn his head to see through the wreck. Their minds racing, the kids start moving away. Charles grabs his Super 8 camera, eager to document everything, as Alice hurries past, searching for her keys while eyeing the approaching flashlight men. Joe grabs his film make-up kit and runs to the car, followed by the boys as Alice slams the car into reverse, narrowly avoiding debris and driving away as the flashlight men—soldiers likely dispatched due to the military cargo on the train—arrive with adrenaline pumping. Colonel Nelec, known for his strict enforcement of secrecy, steps up to the camera, eyeing the vanishing car suspiciously, then looks down at a fresh, empty yellow Super 8 film box, picks it up, examines it, then back at the disappearing car. His burning eyes focus before the Buick speeds past with a roar, as Charles obsesses over his camera amidst the overlapping mayhem, eager to capture every dramatic moment.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Joe kneels and picks something up as Cary calls out from behind having climbed the angled sides of overturned train cars. They move up the mass of metal to reveal a vast view of the wreck which seems to stretch on forever. Cary points to a pickup truck thrown fifty yards from the main wreckage sheared in half and lying in the overgrown grass. As the kids approach from the wreckage the sight stuns them and they stop. Inside the crushed truck is Dr Woodward 75 seatbelted bloody and unconscious. Alice scared and sad moves closer and nudges him realizing he appears dead as his arm drops limp revealing a paper that falls to the ground. Joe picks up the paper and unfolds it revealing an old offwhite map. They hold it up and see marker writing on it a black line from Nevada to Dayton with numbers along the way. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Suddenly a trembling hand appears and rips the map away causing them all to scream as Dr Woodward is revealed with bloody eyes open and in a daze. Speechless they finally react but distant voices make Joe turn his head to see through the wreck. Their minds racing. the kids start moving away. Charles grabs his camera as Alice hurries past searching for her keys while eyeing the approaching flashlight men. Joe grabs his makeup kit and runs to the car followed by the boys as Alice slams the car into reverse narrowly avoiding debris and driving away as the flashlight men—soldiers—arrive with adrenaline pumping. Colonel Nelec steps up to the camera eyeing the vanishing car suspiciously then looks down at a fresh empty yellow Super 8 film box picks it up examines it then back at the disappearing car. His burning eyes focus before the Buick speeds past with a roar as Charles obsesses over his camera amidst the overlapping mayhem.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tom hops and snatches something down as Dana whispers up from above, having skated the curved edges of falling boulders. They glide down the sea of gravel to unveil an endless panorama of the ruins, which appear to taper off to infinity. Dana gestures to a bicycle flung seventy leagues from the central debris, split into pieces and resting in the tangled bushes. As the felines wander away from the debris, the vista baffles them, and they pause. Beneath the mangled bicycle is Professor Lindsey, 82, harnessed, bruised, and asleep. Lucy, anxious and upset, drifts farther and nudges her, realizing she seems alive as her leg flops rigid, dropping a feather that drifts to the soil. Tom lifts the feather and inspects it, uncovering an ancient, faded scroll. They raise it up and notice crayon scribbling on it, a red path from Oregon to Miami, with letters along the route. Abruptly, a shaking foot appears and snatches the scroll away, causing them all to giggle as Professor Lindsey is uncovered, with stained lips ajar and in a trance. Dumbfounded, they eventually respond but quiet murmurs make Tom tilt his gaze to see beyond the ruins. Their thoughts whirling, the felines begin gliding forward. Mark snatches his sketchbook as Lucy sprints past, hunting for her mittens while watching the nearing shadowy figures. Tom seizes his toolbox and dashes to the sailboat, tailed by the kittens as Lucy thrusts the sailboat into forward, narrowly bypassing obstacles and coasting away as the shadowy figures—zookeepers—arrive with energy surging. Major Redding moves closer to the sketchbook, eyeing the receding sailboat pensively, then glances down at a dusty, empty green VHS tape box, snatches it, scrutinizes it, then back at the dwindling sailboat. His glowing eyes narrow before the Ford races across with a hum, as Mark fixates on his sketchbook amidst the swirling chaos.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Joe and Cary navigate overturned train cars to survey a seemingly endless wreck. Cary points to a truck thrown far from the main wreckage, with Dr. Woodward inside, bloodied and unconscious. Alice, frightened, approaches and accidentally dislodges a paper from his grip. Joe retrieves the paper, discovering an old map with a marked route from Nevada to Dayton. Suddenly, Dr. Woodward revives, startling the kids. Hearing approaching voices, they quickly retreat. Charles grabs his camera, while Alice frantically searches for her keys. As soldiers approach, led by Colonel Nelec, Alice reverses her car, narrowly dodging debris to escape. Nelec inspects an empty Super 8 film box, eyes fixed on the fleeing car, while Charles remains fixated on his camera amidst the chaos.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: His burning eyes focus before the Buick speeds past with a roar as Charles obsesses over his camera amidst the overlapping mayhem Colonel Nelec steps up to the camera eyeing the vanishing car suspiciously then looks down at a fresh empty yellow Super 8 film box picks it up examines it then back at the disappearing car Joe grabs his makeup kit and runs to the car followed by the boys as Alice slams the car into reverse narrowly avoiding debris and driving away as the flashlight men—soldiers—arrive with adrenaline pumping Charles grabs his camera as Alice hurries past searching for her keys while eyeing the approaching flashlight men the kids start moving away Their minds racing Speechless they finally react but distant voices make Joe turn his head to see through the wreck Suddenly a trembling hand appears and rips the map away causing them all to scream as Dr Woodward is revealed with bloody eyes open and in a daze They hold it up and see marker writing on it a black line from Nevada to Dayton with numbers along the way Joe picks up the paper and unfolds it revealing an old offwhite map Alice scared and sad moves closer and nudges him realizing he appears dead as his arm drops limp revealing a paper that falls to the ground Inside the crushed truck is Dr Woodward 75 seatbelted bloody and unconscious As the kids approach from the wreckage the sight stuns them and they stop Cary points to a pickup truck thrown fifty yards from the main wreckage sheared in half and lying in the overgrown grass They move up the mass of metal to reveal a vast view of the wreck which seems to stretch on forever Joe kneels and picks something up as Cary calls out from behind having climbed the angled sides of overturned train cars
